availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Bishop (Clay County, KY, soldier (14th cav USA))

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Resident of Clay County in 1850. Farm laborer in Clay County, Kentucky in 1860. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a private from February 13, 1863 to March 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 130B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, p. 106.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 386.
